column4: Anyone know how to fix the "only wallpaper loading" on Ubuntu 11.10? When I log in, it only loads the wallpaper, nothing else.
click the ubuntu icon next to your name, and select ubuntu-2d, and see if that works
I don't even have that top bar - all I see if the wallpaper. But I did try loading ubuntu-2d via terminal; it didn't help.
try metacity --replace via terminal, DISPLAY=:0 metacity --replace
you can get back to the login screen with ctrl-alt-sysrq-k
(sysrq == print screen button)
It's a server :/
this is what i see when i log in - http://cl.ineal.me/1L1G422B0j1S383z0Z1B
yeah you need to use ubuntu-2d
or run metacity --replace
you only have to set the DISPLAY variable if you are running from a tty that isn't in the desktop session
Ah, with metacity --replace, i get the top thing to close folder/apps
Is there any way I can make it load ubuntu-2d by default?
yes, click the ubuntu icon next to your name when you log in, and select ubuntu-2d
or install gnome-session-fallback for a more gnome 2 like experience (with gnome-panel)
It's a server and I use NX NoMachine to login
the sessions are in /usr/share/xsessions/
im not sure how nx selects them
I want nx to select ubuntu-2d right? or gnome-fallback?
either one should work, choose depending on your preferences
xfce would also work
Awesome, I changed nx config to load gnome-classic and it worked!
